newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Volume was 1.4 billion yuan against 2.1 billion on Monday with the 60-day contract the most active.
Traders said the rates wavered in a narrow range today with state banks being net lenders due to ample short-term money supply at the national level.

Non-bank financial institutions kept borrowing on the market to trade on the active domestic A share market, they said. The Shanghai Short-term Fund Financing Centre, the money brokerage run by the central bank, was the most active trader today.
Traders expect the rates to move narrowly in the short term in the absense of market-moving news.
